text: Clarification question...are you looking to create a single pages out of blog posts?  I do this for a client on the starter version of HubSpot CMS (which doesn't include HubDB).

Let's say you have 2 page templates: A Product Page Template and an Accessories Page Template.

Both use a section called "section-text-media". The default text, media and settings for the Product Template are different than what would be displayed for the Accessories Page Template.

If I change the content on an accessory page and save section, can I include that in a new Page Template in the design manager or do I have to create a new section?

Ideally, HubSpot would provide me with a path to that saved section and I could use an include like so:
``` {% include_dnd_partial path="../sections/...%}```

I'm new to HubSpot CMS... I come from mainly a WordPress background where I had my own custom made Bootstrap 4 theme. How difficult is it to use Bootstrap 5 with HubSpot CMS? As I understand it, HS is built on the Bootstrap 2 scaffolding/grid. I just find BS2 lacking in terms of responsive functionality and I'm used to coding with BS4. I was thinking I'd use BS5 because it's the newest one ... I never did update my old WordPress theme to the latest BS. Is it a matter of mapping the BS2 classes to the BS5 ones, and overriding the CSS? Has anyone already done this in a base theme for HubSpot already that I can just use?
